1498856241241669639.text: And we must end the xenophobic policies of the previous administration and reform our immigration system once and for all. #SOTU2022

1498856239542980610.text: We must pursue all options to achieve inclusive and humane immigration reform for the largest number of undocumented immigrants to help decrease workforce shortages and boost our economic recovery. #SOTU2022

1498856238066581510.text: As we continue our work towards a more perfect Union, we cannot forget the well-being of the millions of undocumented immigrants who remain critical to our nation’s success. #SOTU2022

1498852322574839812.text: I also echo President Biden’s call to make the wealthiest Americans and corporations pay their fair share, which will unleash our ability to invest in universal pre-K, affordable childcare, and permanently expand the Child Tax Credit and the Earned Income Tax Credit.

1498850324123201536.text: We can do more to rebuild a fairer, more sustainable economic future for working people. I support @POTUS's call for lowering costs for American families, strengthening supply chains, and boosting our domestic economy by increasing our productive capacity. #SOTU

1498846619118170114.text: I look forward to continue advancing the forward-leaning diplomacy animated by our values that President Biden is pursuing.

1408464317138223105.text: As young women, they worked in WWI-era factories—one of which was right here in Orange, NJ—painting watch dials using glow-in-the-dark, radium-infused paint. The companies never warned them about the dangers of radium, and many later developed terrible and often fatal illnesses.

1408464315783520265.text:

1362498847788908547.text: Proud to introduce the #USCitizenshipAct w/ @RepLindaSanchez & many of our colleagues. 1362458859697274881.text: And to those who dare call this bill amnesty and preach xenophobia & hate: the status quo deprives us of the economic benefits of inclusive, lasting reform. Enough with this notion that immigration reform is somehow a loss to Republicans and not a win for America.

1362458771730096128.text: This bill will bring the 11 million out of the shadows, give them the opportunity to pass criminal background and national security checks, secure Lawful Prospective Immigrant Status, eventually apply for Green Cards & after 8 years begin the naturalization process.

1362458675701506056.text: We know the path forward will demand negotiations with the other side, but we will never win an argument we don’t have the courage to make. We must make our case for bold, inclusive and lasting immigration reform.

1362458530444439554.text: The 11 million undocumented are not "bad hombres.” They are Dreamers & TPS holders, farmworkers & meatpackers, relatives, friends and essential workers who kept our economy afloat in this pandemic. Immigration reform will make America stronger.

1362458418410369025.text: I’ve worked on immigration reform for nearly 30 years. The reason we haven’t gotten it done yet is not because Americans don’t support it. They do. The problem is we’ve capitulated too quickly to fringe voices that yell "amnesty" at anything accepting the humanity of immigrants.

1362458417567268865.text: Today, @RepLindaSanchez  & I unveiled the U.S. Citizenship Act, legislation that brings to life @POTUS’s plan to restore humanity and American values to our immigration system after four years of Trump’s hateful horror show.

1360700966065037312.text: 12/ In private, they complain about feeling trapped by President Trump’s poisonous grip on the Republican Party and yet refused to free themselves by voting to bar him from running for future office.

1360700965045862411.text: 11/ I am dismayed that so many Senate Republicans chose to put the fleeting politics of the moment ahead of their sworn oath to protect the Constitution of the United States.

1360700963774996486.text: 10/ To vote for conviction and disqualification from serving should not have been a difficult decision for any member of the Senate, of any party.

1360700962629910529.text: 9/ All we heard from his team were dangerous arguments that, if indulged by the Senate, would give every future outgoing President permission to use their final weeks in office to commit gross abuses of power without accountability.

1360700961010892812.text:
8/ I cannot think of any higher betrayal of our Constitution and dereliction of duty by a Commander-in-Chief than refusing to act to save American lives. 
 
President Trump’s behavior was unforgivable, and his own lawyers failed to mount any compelling defense.

1360700958951563267.text: 7/ The House impeachment managers also made abundantly clear that President Trump could have quickly acted to save lives and defend the Capitol, but instead spent hours basking in the chaos unfolding in his name.

1360700956976029697.text: 6/ We also learned that the President’s mob came perilously close to harming Vice President Pence and his family and members of the House and Senate, and that extraordinary heroism by law enforcement prevented more tragedy.

1360700954425835521.text: 5/ Seven people lost their lives, including a Capitol Police officer from New Jersey; scores suffered serious injuries and many will carry unseen scars with them for years.

1360700952827863045.text:
4/ Then, on January 6th, as Congress gathered to carry out our constitutional duty, he rallied his angry mob to fight on his behalf and stop the certification of the election results. 
 Our nation paid a heavy price for the lies President Trump spread so freely.

1360700951712190469.text: 3/ For weeks, he used malicious lies and conspiracy theories to foment anger and mobilized his supporters to descend on Washington in a last-ditch effort to ‘stop the steal.’
